label: SHRM10000
info_overview: The smart smoke sensor detects smoke, and sends an alarm signals to alert of danger. When the smart smoke sensor detects smoke, it will send an alarm notification to your controller through wireless Z-Wave communication protocol.
info_inclusion:
• Press the pin 3 times within 1.5s, Green LED is Blinking 3 times within 1 second.
  • If Inclusion Process is successful, Green led will turn off.
info_exclusion:
• Press the pin 3 times within 1.5s.
  • If Exclusion Process is successful, Green led is Blinking 6 times, then turn off.
info_wakeup:
• Wake up Notification is transmitted every 24 hours by default.
  • Wake up Notification is transmitted after Notification Report is Transmitted.
approved_export:

The smart smoke sensor detects smoke, and sends an alarm signals to alert of danger. When the smart smoke sensor detects smoke, it will send an alarm notification to your\u00a0controller through wireless Z-Wave communication protocol.<\/p>", "inclusion": "

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.description: Battery, Notification, Reset locally Notification, Binary report
associations.overview: Association group 1: Lifeline association groupInclude command classes: Battery report, Notification report, and Device Reset Locally notification, Binary report.

associations.label: Root device Group (binary sensor)
associations.description: Binary smoke sensor via lifeline and on status Chance of smoke detection
associations.overview: Association group 2: Root Device group(Binary Sensor)Binary Sensor Command Class: Compatible with 300 series1-Binary Sensor reports status of smoke or no smoke via Lifeline.2-When the sensor detects status change between smoke and no smoke, the device will be triggered.

associations.label: Root device Group (notification)
associations.description: smoke status as notification report and on status change of smoke detection
associations.overview: Association group 3: Root Device group(Notification)1-Notification reports reports status of detect smoke or no smoke via Lifeline.2-When the sensor detects status change between smoke and no smoke, the device will be triggered.

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<ProductExport xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <Id>3006</Id>
  <Name>Smart Smoke Alarm</Name>
  <Description>The Smart Smoke Alarm adopts Z-Wave protocol, when the sensor detects smoke to the set level, it will issue  acoustic-optic alarm to alert the users and also send alarm notifications to gateway immediately.It's suitable to be installed in living room, office,warehouse,and etc.</Description>
  <Description_Short>The Smart Smoke Alarm adopts Z-Wave protocol, when the sensor detects smoke to the set level, it will issue  acoustic-optic alarm to alert the users and also send alarm notifications to gateway immediately.</Description_Short>
  <Brand>HEIMAN</Brand>
  <Identifier>HS1SA-Z</Identifier>
  <CertificationNumber>ZC10-18076198</CertificationNumber>
  <OemVersion>HW: 255 FW: 3.01</OemVersion>
  <HardwarePlatform>ZM5202</HardwarePlatform>
  <ZWaveVersion>6.71.03</ZWaveVersion>
  <LibraryType>Routing Slave</LibraryType>
  <DeviceType>Notification Sensor</DeviceType>
  <RoleType>Reporting Sleeping Slave</RoleType>
  <ManufacturerId>0x0260</ManufacturerId>
  <ProductTypeId>0x8002</ProductTypeId>
  <ProductId>0x1000</ProductId>
  <FrequencyName>CEPT (Europe)</FrequencyName>
  <UserIcon>0x0C01</UserIcon>
  <InstallerIcon>0x0C01</InstallerIcon>
  <ManualUrl>https://Products.Z-WaveAlliance.org/ProductManual/File?folder=&filename=Manuals/3006/HS1SA-Z S2-documentation_3.pdf</ManualUrl>
  <InclusionDescription>-  Click [Add] icon in Z-Wave Controller .
-  Press the Net_Button 3 times within 1.5s, Green LED is Blinking 3 times within 1 second.
-  If Inclusion Process is successful, Green led will turn off.
</InclusionDescription>
  <ExclusionDescription>-  Click [Remove] icon in Z-Wave Controller
-  Press the Net_Button 3 times within 1.5s 
-  If Exclusion Process is successful, Green led is Blinking 6 times, then turn off.
</ExclusionDescription>
  <LearnModeDescription />
  <ResetDescription>--Long press Net_Button while installing batteries in the product.
- Device Reset Locally notification is Transmitted.
Please use this procedure only when the network primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable.
</ResetDescription>
  <WakeupDescription />
  <OtherSpecialFeaturesDescription />
  <CertificationApprovedDate>2018-07-30T23:51:48.104385</CertificationApprovedDate>
  <Image>https://products.z-wavealliance.org/ProductImages/Index?productName=ZC10-18076198</Image>
  <Categories>
    <string>Network Devices</string>
    <string>Security Add-Ons</string>
    <string>Security Systems</string>
    <string>Sensors</string>
  </Categories>
  <SupportedCommandClasses />
  <ControlledCommandClasses />
  <S2Classes>
    <S2ClassExport>
      <Name>S2 Unauthenticated</Name>

  </S2Classes>
  <AssociationGroups>
    <AssociationGroupExport>
      <Description>This is Lifeline association group, Including command classes: Battery report, Notification report, and Device Reset Locally notification</Description>
      <GroupNumber>1</GroupNumber>
      <MaximumNodes>5</MaximumNodes>
    </AssociationGroupExport>
    <AssociationGroupExport>
      <Description>This is Root Device group,The Sensor sends a Basic Set command to directly trigger devices (like a light, switch, etc.) in response to events. The value of the Basic Set command (e.g. Siren trigger) is configured using    smoke or no smoke.</Description>
      <GroupNumber>2</GroupNumber>
      <MaximumNodes>5</MaximumNodes>
    </AssociationGroupExport>
  </AssociationGroups>
  <ConfigurationParameters />
  <Features>
    <FeatureExport>

</featurePrompt>
    </FeatureExport>
    <FeatureExport>
